conclusion: Choose the suspension point of the rod as the origin.
For a freely–falling body released from rest s = ½ g t².
The lower end of the rod reaches the level A when the upper end has dropped s₁ = 20 m – 5 m = 15 m.
Calculate t₁ using ½ g t₁² = 15, resulting in t₁ = √(2 · 15/10) = √3 ≈ 1.73 s.
The upper end of the rod reaches level A when it has dropped the full 20 m.
Calculate t₂ using ½ g t₂² = 20, resulting in t₂ = √(2 · 20/10) = √4 = 2.0 s.
The interval during which the rod passes through level A is t_A = t₂ – t₁ = 2.00 s – 1.73 s ≈ 0.27 s.
